description: From Middle English hardynesse; equivalent to hardy +â€Ž -ness.

entries.meaning: The quality of being able to withstand fatigue and hardship; (of a plant) the quality of being resistant to cold or other environmental conditions.
examples: Kale is known for its winter-hardiness.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The quality of being bold in the face of risk or authority.
examples: Synonyms: hardihood, audacity, boldness, firmness, assurance
